Usually in this type of sensor, the aptamer is immobilized on an electrode. In some applications, no enzyme is employed and binding of the immobilized aptamer to the target changes the impedance directly [ 112]. But in some others, the electrical signal change is assisted by employing enzymatic reactions [ 113]. The latter is a field-effect transistor (FET) which is a type of voltage-controlled semiconductor device that regulates electrical behavior by using an electric field and has been used to detect the Tat protein of HIV-1 [ 114].
